name: Extreme Heat
description: Environmental hazard from temperatures at or above 100 degrees Fahrenheit without access to water that causes exhaustion
trigger: Being exposed to temperatures of 100 degrees Fahrenheit or higher without access to drinkable water

savingThrow.dc: 5 for first hour, increases by 1 each additional hour
savingThrow.disadvantage: Creatures wearing Medium or Heavy armor

duration: ongoing while exposed to extreme heat

ongoing: Constitution saving throw at end of each hour
DC starts at 5 for first hour, increases by 1 each hour (DC 6 second hour, DC 7 third hour, etc.)
Gain 1 Exhaustion level on failed save
Creatures in Medium or Heavy armor have Disadvantage on save

automatic: Creatures with Resistance to Fire damage
Creatures with Immunity to Fire damage

armorPenalty.reason: Armor traps body heat and prevents cooling

detection.method: Feel temperature, see environmental signs (sun, heat shimmer, parched landscape)

mitigation: Access to drinkable water (prevents hazard entirely)
Seek shade during hottest parts of day
Travel during cooler times (dawn, dusk, night)
Remove Medium or Heavy armor to avoid Disadvantage
Use magical cooling (Endure Elements, Create Water)
Have Resistance or Immunity to Fire damage (automatic success on saves)

environmentalContext.waterRequirement: Must lack access to drinkable water
additionalEffects: Strong desert wind can create sandstorms (Disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks)
Heavy precipitation in hot climate extinguishes open flames but creates humidity
Extreme heat often combined with dehydration hazard

progressiveDifficulty.description: Unlike Extreme Cold (static DC 10), Extreme Heat becomes progressively harder to resist
progressiveDifficulty.note: Extended exposure becomes increasingly dangerous even for hardy characters

tacticalConsiderations: Secure water source before entering hot environment
Consider removing armor despite AC loss
Plan travel for cooler times of day
Monitor Exhaustion accumulation - gets harder each hour
Party may need to rest during hottest hours
Characters with high Constitution modifier have advantage over time
Magic users should prepare water-creating spells

srdReference.quote: When the temperature is 100 degrees Fahrenheit or higher, a creature exposed to the extreme heat and without access to drinkable water must succeed on a Constitution saving throw at the end of each hour or gain 1 Exhaustion level. The DC is 5 for the first hour and increases by 1 for each additional hour. Creatures wearing Medium or Heavy armor have Disadvantage on the save. Creatures that have Resistance or Immunity to Fire damage automatically succeed on the save.

examples: Crossing desert without water - Hour 1: DC 5, Hour 2: DC 6, etc.
Armored knight in desert (Disadvantage on all saves)
Exploring volcanic region without fire protection
Lost in badlands after water supplies exhausted
Plane of Fire adventure - extreme heat plus fire hazards
Trapped in burning building (extreme heat + smoke + fire)
